page.title: 12Ecology
page.content: Titchfield Haven Nature Reserve. The Haven is run by the National Trust and has a permanent warden who lives nearby. The grounds cover about 280 acres.The River Meon runs through it and the area is very marshy. The Reserve is open to the public from late August til March by appointment with the warden.The reserve is closed during the summer so as not to disturb the birds in the breeding season. In the winter up to 3000 ducks visit the Haven.Redwings and ducks visit in January,February and March on their way from Africa to Scandinavia. The Warden also traps and rings birds for identification.The rings have a number and British Museum printed on them. There are a number of hides on the site to watch the birds from as ducks are very nervous birds.
